title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 19, ch. VII, pt. 212 - Special Rules for the Conduct of Professional Mixed Martial Arts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 19, ch. VII, pt. 212 - Special Rules for the Conduct of Professional Mixed Martial Arts

State Regulations
§ 212.1 - Application of the unified rules of mixed martial arts
§ 212.2 - General requirements for professional mixed martial arts contests and combatants
§ 212.3 - Number and Length of rounds
§ 212.4 - Weight classes of contestants
§ 212.5 - Proper attire of contestants
§ 212.6 - Physical appearance of combatants
§ 212.7 - Equipment
§ 212.8 - Method of judging and scoring
§ 212.9 - Hand wrapping
§ 212.10 - Fouls; Acts constituting fouls
§ 212.11 - Deduction of points for fouls; effect of low blow
§ 212.12 - Accidental and intentional fouls resulting in injury
§ 212.13 - Results of contests
§ 212.14 - Use of prohibited substances; detection and penalties
§ 212.15 - Appointment and compensation of officials

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 19, ch. VII, pt. 212

Statutory authority: Unconsolidated Law, § 8901; L. 1996, ch. 708

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
